newsitem.title: USA: IES says Ottumwa, Iowa coal plant back Weds.
newsitem.headline: IES says Ottumwa, Iowa coal plant back Weds.

text.p: IES Utilities Inc said it expects the 675 megawatt Ottumwa coal-fired power plant to resume production Wednesday after an unexpected shutdown to repair a boiler tube leak.
"We expect it to be back on about mid-morning tomorrow," an IES Utilities spokesman said Tuesday.
The plant, located near the town of Ottumwa in southeastern Iowa, was shut Sunday to repair the leak.
IES Utilities holds about a 48 percent interest and operates the plant, with MidAmerican Energy Co holding the remaining interest.
IES Utilities is a subsidiary of IES Industries Inc.
